intro: Ardisia bracteosa, commonly known as the red-berried ardisia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, white flowers that are followed by bright red berries. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and showy fruit, making it popular in horticulture. However, it can be invasive in some regions, posing a threat to native ecosystems.
